snippet: American Indians, who use dead eagles for traditional ceremonies, face long waits for the animals when they submit applications to the National Eagle Repository outside Denver.
abstract: Growing backlog of applications and a slew of court battles has raised questions about whether the National Eagle Repository in Denver can sufficiently cope with the demand for bald and golden eagle carcasses, which American Indians use in traditional ceremonies.
lead_paragraph: American Indians, who use dead eagles for traditional ceremonies, face long waits for the animals when they submit applications to the National Eagle Repository outside Denver.

headline.main: A Repository for Eagles Finds Itself in Demand
headline.print_headline: A Repository For Eagles Finds Itself In Demand
